name: MLCMultiheadAttentionDescriptor
desc: A configuration object you use to create a multi-head attention layer.

items.name: init(modelDimension: Int, headCount: Int)
items.desc: Creates a multi-head attention descriptor with the model dimension and number of parallel attention heads you specify.

items.name: init?(modelDimension: Int, keyDimension: Int, valueDimension: Int, headCount: Int, dropout: Float, hasBiases: Bool, hasAttentionBiases: Bool, addsZeroAttention: Bool)
items.desc: Creates a multi-head attention descriptor with the dimensions, number of attention heads, dropout rate, and bias and padding options you specify.

items.name: var keyDimension: Int
items.desc: The total dimension of key space, which must be divisible by the number of heads.

items.name: var valueDimension: Int
items.desc: The total dimension of value space, which must be divisible by the number of heads.

items.name: var headCount: Int
items.desc: The number of parallel attention heads.

items.name: var dropout: Float
items.desc: The dropout rate you apply to the output projection weights.

items.name: var hasBiases: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that specifies whether you add a bias to query, key, value, and output projections.

items.name: var hasAttentionBiases: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that specifies whether you add an array of biases to key and value, respectively.

items.name: var addsZeroAttention: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that specifies whether you add a row of zeros to projected key and value.
